alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 8:55AM CDT until March 31 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Alabama River At Montgomery affecting Dallas, Montgomery, Elmore, Lowndes and Autauga Counties. Alabama River At R.F. Henry Lock and Dam affecting Lowndes, Autauga and Dallas Counties. Alabama River At Selma affecting Dallas County. .Flooding continues on the Alabama River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alabama River At Selma. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, Extensive overflow of low lying lands in the area begins. Some low roads in the area begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 39.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday morning to a crest of 45.1 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 45.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
